class Test.models_test.TestPitchObject(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

Tests the PitchObject class. The tests include the modification of the object and methods for getting the polygons that bound the object.

setUp()[source]¶
test_PitchObject_initialisation()[source]¶

Checks if width, length and height can’t be set as negative. Also checks if valid values are accepted.

test_PitchObject_modification()[source]¶

Checks if vector can’t be set to None

test_generic_polygon()[source]¶

Checks if the points returned by the generic polygon method are correct

class Test.models_test.TestRobot(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

Tests the Robot class. The tests cover the initialisation and gets paths to the ball, checks for possession etc.

setUp()[source]¶
test_displacement_and_angle()[source]¶

Checks if the displacement and angle by which the robot needs to turn to be facing the given point

class Test.models_test.TestVector(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

Tests the Vector class. Our assumption is that Vector extends Coordinate so we do not retest the coordinate attribute initialisation and assignment.

setUp()[source]¶
test_correct_assignment()[source]¶

This test checks if the edge values of speed and angle can be chosen. There is no way of checking if something does not raise an error, so I’m just using a hack...

test_wrong_assignment()[source]¶

This test checks if the Vector object can be incorrectly updated.

test_wrong_initialisation()[source]¶

This test checks if the Vector object can be initialised incorrectly.
